utils.database module

utils.database.check_db_connection()[source]

Check the database connection and uptime.

This function attempts to execute a simple query on the database to verify the connection. It also calculates the elapsed time since the application started.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • bool: True if the database connection is successful, False otherwise.

  • float or None: The elapsed time since the application started (in seconds), or None if the connection failed.

Return type:

tuple

utils.database.hash_password(password)[source]

Hashes a plain-text password.

Parameters:

password (str) – The plain-text password to be hashed.

Returns:

The hashed password.

Return type:

str

utils.database.init_db(app)[source]

Initialize the database connection and create tables.

This function configures the SQLAlchemy database URI, initializes the app context for SQLAlchemy, and creates all required tables in the database. It also inserts a default admin user if it doesn’t already exist.

Parameters:

app (Flask) – The Flask application instance.

Note

The database is assumed to be a Microsoft SQL Server instance configured via SQLAlchemy.

utils.security module

utils.security.create_token(user_id)[source]

Create a JSON Web Token (JWT) for a user.

Parameters:

user_id (str) – The unique identifier of the user.

Returns:

A JWT encoded as a string.

Return type:

str

Note

The token includes: - exp: Expiration time (4 days from now). - iat: Issued at time (10 hours earlier than the current time). - sub: The subject, representing the user’s ID.

utils.security.decode_token(token)[source]

Decode a JWT to extract the user ID.

Parameters:

token (str) – The JWT to decode.

Returns:

The user ID (sub field) extracted from the token.

Return type:

str

Note

The function assumes the token is encoded using the HS256 algorithm.

utils.security.extract_auth_token(authenticated_request)[source]

Extract the JWT from the Authorization header of a request.

Parameters:

authenticated_request (Request) – The authenticated Flask request object.

Returns:

The JWT if present in the Authorization header, else None.

Return type:

str or None
